UCM.Name: Palatine
SpecRules: Magellan Lifeboats:  If this ship is destroyed with an Admiral assigned to it you may transfer your Admiral to another friendly ship of H or S Tonnage within 18"
Advanced Artillery: This ship may fire its N-12 Artillery Cannon while on the Max Thrust or Silent Running Special Orders
Remnant: This ship may be used in UCM or PHR fleets in addition to Reistance fleets. In UCM and PHR fleets, it gains the Rare special rule

UCM.Name: Hyperyacht Aurorum
SpecRules: Mercenary: This ship may be used in any fleet, but you may only include a single Hyperyacht Aurorum in your fleet, regardless of game size. This ship's Fighets & Bombers use the stats of its parent fleet. (If you included this ship in a Scourge fleet, it's Fighters & Bombers would follow the Scourge Fighters & Bombers rules.)

UCM.Name: Nuuk
SpecRules: Haywire: â€œIf this weapon hits, the targeted ship receives a Power Fluctuations token (even if it is not a Dreadnought). The ship suffers D3 Hull Points if going on Special Orders. If the targeted ship is using the Silent Running special orders, Signature is returned to normal instead. The targeted ship may not go on silent running

UCM.Name: St Petersburg
SpecRules: Siphon Power - If firing only one of these two weapons, increase its Burnthrough value to Burnthrough(8)

UCM.Name: Lysander
SpecRules: Stealth Observation: This ship can Survey a Cluster regardless of its Battlegroup Tonnage value

UCM.Name: Venice
SpecRules: Command Deck - If you mount your Admiral in this ship, when drawing Command Cards, you may draw 2 more than normal.

UCM Battlenet - As long as this ship is on the board, when a friendly Battlegroup on the board activates (including this one), you may choose to discard 1 Command Card and that Battlegroup gains 1 of the following bonuses when on Special Orders:
â€¢ Any ships in that Battlegroup may add 4" to their movement for this activation (after any Thrust modifiers).

â€¢ Any ships in that Battlegroup may fire 1 additional weapon system during this activation (or may fire their Close Action weapons if otherwise not allowed to fire any, but may not launch Launch Assets).

â€¢ Any ships in that Battlegroup may change Orbital Layer, even if they otherwise would not be allowed to do so (all normal restrictions apply such as costing Thrust distance and only entering Atmosphere if they have the Atmospheric special rule).

Scourge.Name: Hyperyacht Aurorum
SpecRules: Mercenary: This ship may be used in any fleet, but you may only include a single Hyperyacht Aurorum in your fleet, regardless of game size. This ship's Fighets & Bombers use the stats of its parent fleet. (If you included this ship in a Scourge fleet, it's Fighters & Bombers would follow the Scourge Fighters & Bombers rules.)

Scourge.Name: Parasite
SpecRules: Energy Siphon: â€œDuring this shipâ€™s activation, either before or after movement, pick one friendly or enemy ship within 3â€ without the Energy Siphon special rule to siphon. That ship loses any Spike it has, and this ship gains it. If any ships in this Group have siphoned any Spikes, all ships in this Group modify their Occulus Rays for this activation. If the Group siphoned one or more Minor Spikes, the Attack of Oculus Rays increases to 2. If the Group siphoned one or more Major Spikes, the Damage of Oculus Rays increases to 2. This group may gain both benefits of this rule in its activation, but may only gain each benefit once each activation.

Scourge.Name: Incubus
SpecRules: Cloaking Crest: This ship may take a Cloaking Crest for +5pts, and gains Stealth and Partial Cloak

Scourge.Name: Succubus
SpecRules: Cloaking Crest: This ship may take a Cloaking Crest for +5pts, and gains Stealth and Partial Cloak.

Scourge.Name: Revenant
SpecRules: Cloaking Crest: This ship may take a Cloaking Crest for +5pts, and gains Stealth and Partial Cloak.

Scourge.Name: Charybdis
SpecRules: Low Level: This weapon may be fired from atmosphere with no penalties to it's lock value.

Scourge.Name: Pungari Thresher
SpecRules: Pungari Bulk Landers only drop Infantry Assets.

Scourge.Name: Hiruko
SpecRules: Ramming Ship: If this ship ends its activation within 3â€ of an enemy ship, it may attempt to ram it. That ship takes 2 lock 3+ hits with the Corruptor special rule and this ship is removed from play.

Scourge.Name: Umbra
SpecRules: Oculus Booster: When this ship is given Standard Orders, until the start of its next activation, other friendly shipâ€™s weapons with â€œOculusâ€ in their name increase their Scald penalty to +3 instead of +1 when firing at ships in any orbital layer within 12â€ in shipâ€™s Front Arc

PHR.Name: Palatine
SpecRules: Magellan Lifeboats:  If this ship is destroyed with an Admiral assigned to it you may transfer your Admiral to another friendly ship of H or S Tonnage within 18"
Advanced Artillery: This ship may fire its N-12 Artillery Cannon while on the Max Thrust or Silent Running Special Orders
Remnant: This ship may be used in UCM or PHR fleets in addition to Reistance fleets. In UCM and PHR fleets, it gains the Rare special rule

PHR.Name: Hyperyacht Aurorum
SpecRules: Mercenary: This ship may be used in any fleet, but you may only include a single Hyperyacht Aurorum in your fleet, regardless of game size. This ship's Fighets & Bombers use the stats of its parent fleet. (If you included this ship in a Scourge fleet, it's Fighters & Bombers would follow the Scourge Fighters & Bombers rules.)

PHR.Name: Ourania
SpecRules: Targeting Link: If a friendly firing ship can measure its Weapons Range to this ship (discounting any spikes), it may use this ship to extend the range of its attacks. If it does, it measures Weapons Range from the Ouriana using the Ourianaâ€™s Scan. Attacks made this way must still be in the weapon arc of the firing ship and can only have range extended once this way. This rule has no effect on Close Action weapons and Bombardment weapons and all penalties for shooting through Orbital Layers still apply to the firing ship.â€™

Weapons.Name: XN-31 Mass Driver Turret Pair
Weapons.FullString: XN-31 Mass Driver Turret Pair F/S

PHR.Name: Remus
SpecRules: The Remus is Limited to 4 Torpedoes total, and may fire all of them in one round.
Apocalypse Cannon: When you Overcharge these weapons, if this ship is on the Weapons Free Special Order, they triple their damage instead of doubling their damage.

PHR.Name: Calypso
SpecRules: Once per turn, after an enemy group has allocated Attack Dice, you may pick a friendly ship within 4â€ of the Calypso. Add 1 to the lock value of the groups Attack Dice allocated to this ship. Subsequent attacks by other groups are not affected. In order to be affected, ships must be on the same orbital layer as the Calypso, in addition the calypso can choose to target itself. This is cumulative with other Advanced ECM Suites. This rule may not be used against Launch Assets nor weapons with the close action special rule

PHR.Name: Medea
SpecRules: Low Level: This weapon may be fired from atmosphere with no penalties to it's lock value.

PHR.Name: Pungari Thresher
SpecRules: Pungari Bulk Landers only drop Infantry Assets.

PHR.Name: Harpocrates
SpecRules: EM Sabotage: If this weapon hits, the target ship receives an Engines Disabled token and a Weapons Offline token. Engines Disabled reduces Thrust by 50% (rounded up), and the ship may not turn or change orbit, but can be repaired as normal. Weapons Offline prevents a ship from firing any weapons and launching any launch assets the next time it would be able to. Subsequent activations the ship may fire and launch assets as normal.

PHR.Name: Agrippa
SpecRules: Holo-Debris Field: Holo-debris Field: At the end of this shipâ€™s activation, if this ship is on the Weapons Free or Station Keeping Special Order you may place a Dense Debris Field within 3â€ of this ship. These debris fields are removed at the end of the Roundup phase and are circular with a 4â€ diameter (a D6 or custom template are perfect tokens to represent these). Friendly ships and Launch Assets ignore these Debris Fields.

Shaltari.Name: Hyperyacht Aurorum
SpecRules: Mercenary: This ship may be used in any fleet, but you may only include a single Hyperyacht Aurorum in your fleet, regardless of game size. This ship's Fighets & Bombers use the stats of its parent fleet. (If you included this ship in a Scourge fleet, it's Fighters & Bombers would follow the Scourge Fighters & Bombers rules.)

Shaltari.Name: Silicon
SpecRules: Ion: If a group scores (X) hits from weapons with this special rule, the targeted ship receives an energy surge token. Reducing the ship to only standard orders until repaired

Shaltari.Name: Sapphire
SpecRules: Ion Overload: While this ship is on Weapons Free, it may use its Ion Aura and Ion Storm as if they did not have the Alt-1 special rule.

Shaltari.Name: Pungari Thresher
SpecRules: Pungari Bulk Landers only drop Infantry Assets.

Shaltari.Name: Gold
SpecRules: ION: If a groupe scores (X) hits from weapons with this special rule, the Energy Surge crippling effect is aplied to that ship. If the target is a ship with the Dreadnought special rule apply the Power Fluctuation effect instead.

Shaltari.Name: Silver
SpecRules: GRAVITIC BEAMER: If this weapon successfully damages a ship, the next time that ship's group would move, it may not turn and it increases its total movement (after any Thrust modifiers, including Orders) by 2d3". This rule has no effect on ships outside of the targeted ship's normal Group Coherency range (before any special rules).

Shaltari.Name: Bronze
SpecRules: GRAVITIC BEAMER: If this weapon successfully damages a ship, the next time that ship's group would move, it may not turn and it increases its total movement (after any Thrust modifiers, including Orders) by 2d3". This rule has no effect on ships outside of the targeted ship's normal Group Coherency range (before any special rules).

ION: If a group scores (X) hits from weapons with this special rule, the Energy Surge crippling effect is applied to that ship. If the target is a ship with the Dreadnought special rule apply the Power Fluctuation effect instead.

Shaltari.Name: Helium
SpecRules: Void Skip: If this ship goes on Standard Orders when within 6â€ of a Voidgate, rather than making a normal move, you may place it within 6â€ of any other Voidgate in that Voidgate chain (within 18â€ of each other as normal), facing any direction and it recieves a Minor Spike. It may be put within 1 Orbital Layer (up or down) of the Voidgate it is placed by. When doing this, the whole group must move together.

SpecRules: Magellan Lifeboats:  If this ship is destroyed with an Admiral assigned to it you may transfer your Admiral to another friendly ship of H or S Tonnage within 18"
Advanced Artillery: This ship may fire its N-12 Artillery Cannon while on the Max Thrust or Silent Running Special Orders
Remnant: This ship may be used in UCM or PHR fleets in addition to Reistance fleets. In UCM and PHR fleets, it gains the Rare special rule

Resistance.Name: Pungari Thresher
SpecRules: Pungari Bulk Landers only drop Infantry Assets.

Resistance.Name: Collins
SpecRules: Repair & Refuel: Any Friendly Fighters within 6â€ of this ship on any orbital layer are not removed when the PD bonus they conferred is used.

Resistance.Name: Myrmidon
SpecRules: Scanning Systems: At the start of this ship's activation, you may use its Scanning Systems. If you do, it gains a Major Spike, then either put a Minor Strike on up to two different enemy ships on the tabletop, or automatically reveal up to two different ships on Silent Running as if they were targeted by a successful Active Scan order.

Resistance.Name: Amazon
SpecRules: Spinal Mass Annihilator: Critical hits from this weapon ignore Passive Countermeasures as well as Armour. If a firing procedure containing unsaved damage from this weapon would cause a ship of L, L2, or H tonnage to be destroyed, remove that ship from the game without rolling for catastrophic damage.

Resistance.Name: Seneca
SpecRules: Explosive: When this ship is destroyed, it suffers Catastrophic Damage as if it had Hull 6 (D3").

Resistance.Name: Senator
SpecRules: VX Bomb: If this weapon does damage to a Sector, remove all Ground Assets (friendly and enemy) from that Sector and any Sectors in the same Cluster.
SWACS: Friendly ships may fire their Close Action weapons against enemy ships within 12" of this ship using their normal Weapon Range (Scan + Sig).

Resistance.Name: Triumvir
SpecRules: Repair Bay: Any friendly ships rolling Damage Control within 6â€ of this ship add +2 to their roll. Box Of Scraps: At the end of this shipâ€™s activation, pick one friendly ship within 6â€ in line of sight (including this one). Place a Box Of Scraps token next to that ship. The next time that ship would be destroyed, it isn't. Instead remove the Box of Scraps token and that ship remains in play with D3 Hull Points remaining. Box Of Scraps tokens persist through rounds but a ship may only have 1 Box Of Scraps token.

Resistance.Name: Galileo
SpecRules: Space Telescope: When this ship uses the Active Scan special order, the target ship receives a Major Spike instead of a Minor Spike. If the target ship is on Silent Running and successfully revealed, it receives a Minor Spike. Additionally, place a Telescope token on that ship. A ship may have only 1 Telescope token. You may remove the Telescope token when the shipâ€™s Group is targeted by a single friendly group. If so, the firing Groupâ€™s weapon systems targeting that ship score Critical hits when exceeding their Lock value by one rather than the usual two. For example, a weapon with a 3+ Lock will cause a Critical hit on a 4+ and a weapon with a 5+ Lock will cause a Critical hit on a 6+.
